page.title: 01THE QUIET HILLS OF CLWYD
page.content: There has probably been very little change in this area since the original Domesday Book, it is very rural with only one small community - Bryn Rhyd Yr Arian. One main road disects the block from north to south but mostly there are single track roads linking the farms. The south east corner is cut by the Afon (river) Aled the B5382 road runs paralell to this. It is a fairly hilly area varying between 15m-361m. Almost the entire block is devoted to grazing with many, but small, farms. There is electricity in the area (but no gas sypply) and a bus service otherwise the area has no amenities at all (sorry - one chapel!) The small areas of woodland are very attractive and views from the many vantage points are very pleasant. Hopefully, it will remain as peaceful until the next Domesday Survey!
